derivation.yuyuan_name: late 19th cent.: American coinage of unknown origin

entry.tran: 大吹大擂；大肆宣传；夸大其词
entry.def: You can use ballyhoo to refer to great excitement or anger about something, especially when you disapprove of it because you think it is unnecessary or exaggerated.

example.ex: They announced, amid much ballyhoo, that they had made a breakthrough.
example.tran: 在一通大吹大擂中，他们宣布自己取得了突破。

entry.def: If you say that something is ballyhooed, you mean that there is a lot of excitement about it and people are claiming that it is very good. You use this word especially when you think the thing is not as exciting or good as people say.

example.ex: The power of red wine to counteract high cholesterol has been ballyhooed in the press.
example.tran: 红酒降低胆固醇的功效被媒体夸大了。
受到热炒的新一集《星球大战》电影
